english: He said that she’d be worth two thousand liras now. See, he finds her so valuable because he educated and polished her in this way.

english: janan: There is another room that way, where our nanny sleeps.

english: Râkım (without interrupting): They also love me, yet I swear on my faith and honor that I’ve never heard a single syllable, never seen a single move from them that would substantiate what you’re saying.

turkish: Allah’ın merhametini bu sûretle kazanabileceğim ümidindeyim.............

turkish: Râkım - Ama ben ona acırım Yozefino, acırım. Zira ne kadar olsa refîkim idi.
english: Râkım: But I still feel sorry for him Josephine, I do, because at the end of the day he is still my friend.

turkish: Saatlere baktılar, saat on.
english: They looked at the time; it was around five.

turkish: Bizim efendi o kız için pek çok düşünmektedir de.....
english: Master thinks about that girl so much.

turkish: Polini - Bravo!
english: pauline: Bravo!

turkish: Artık Râkım’ın hiçbir tarafa göz ucuyla bile bakmayacağından ben emin olabilirim.

turkish: Kızın bu kadar amcazâdeleri, dayızâdeleri filânları var iken başkasına ve bâ-husûs bir Türk’e ve bâ-husûs kendi hocasına vermek ârını nasıl hazmedebileceğini kocasına sorarak ölümüne razı olmak lâzım geleceğini hükmeyledi...
english: She concluded that they needed to resign themselves to her death and asked her husband how he could bear the shame of marrying their daughter to someone else when the girls had so many cousins. Especially to a Turk and, what’s worse, her teacher.

turkish: Zavallı kızcağız!

turkish: Lâkin Canan nereye gitti?
english: By the way, where did Janan go?

english: jan: Don’t you trust our good morals?

turkish: Canan!
english: Janan!

turkish: Hattâ Râkım bana acıdığından ötürü sizin dediğinize razı olacak olsa bile, ben razı olmam.
english: In fact, even if Rakim, out of pity for me, were to agree to do what you are asking, I wouldn’t agree.

english: Accordingly, they called the doctor again who, after examining the girl thoroughly, couldn’t make sense of how the illness had taken such a turn. As a precaution, before he departed the doctor gave her a syrup that would neither benefit nor harm her, suggested she continue to eat well, and protect herself from the cold, moisture, and dust.

turkish: İşte Râkım dahi böyle senin gibi, seni sevdiği hâlde bir kelimecik söylemez imiş.

english: brunette lady: This is my offer!

turkish: Kim bilir!

turkish: Dikkat etmedin mi? Nasıl kıpkırmızı oluyor idi.

Binaenaleyh Râkım kendileriyle ifâde-i merâma muktedir olacağından ders hakkında dahi muvaffak olacağını anladı.
english: This family hailed from Canterbury. The town’s proximity to France, together with their trade business, led them to develop social relations with the French. That’s why every member of the family could speak French very well.

english: janan (with growing apprehension): That’s a lot of money, isn’t it, Sir?

english: Come, don't be scared my dear.

english: janan: Madame!

english: Râkım: How did he learn about my female slave?

turkish: Ne mümkün!

english: pauline: Our lobster Felatun is such a saucy man.

turkish: Bugün zihnim pek perişandır.

english: After her father’s death, when Felatun Bey stopped showing up at his father’s house, the neighbors began giving her advice, and she married a thirty-year-old level-headed and educated captain who’d been all over the place. At first her husband found the poor girl flighty and didn’t like her much; however, after recognizing her potential to become cultured, he thought that abandoning her wouldn’t be as chivalrous as trying to educate her. Hence, he offered the girl much fatherly advice, brotherly suggestions, husbandly warnings, and cured her of her flightiness, thus making her love him as a loyal friend.

turkish: Matbaacı dahi yekten yirmi lirayı verdi.

english: He didn’t bother inquiring about the salary but his friend suggested that the family pay him one British lira per lesson.

turkish: Can - (yürekleri eritecek kadar acı bir tebessüm ile) Acayip!
english: jan (with a bitter smile that could pierce a person’s heart): How strange!

english: Mr. Ziklas couldn’t think of more than two or three people apart from his own family, Rakim and the servants.

english: The doctors couldn’t identify the problem, so they gave up, saying that she had an incurable defect.

english: Râkım: Your piano teacher sends her regards.

english: Janan looked happy when she heard that Josephine was going to stay with them that night and sleep in her bed.

english: You know the neighborhood, right?

turkish: Ah zayıf sadrın!
english: Ah, how fragile she is!

turkish: Ben Râkım Efendi’yi senden çok ve senden alâ tanırım!..
english: I know Rakim Efendi much better than you do!

turkish: Felâtun Bey’i hatırda tutuyor musunuz?.............
english: Do you ever recall Felatun Bey?

english: In the meantime, Felatun Bey’s father, Mustafa Meraki Efendi, died a natural death after suffering for about fifteen days from the sickness his son had mentioned.

turkish: Ama bu dahi hakkında bir nimet idi. “Ah!
english: But even this was a kind of blessing.

english: be so terrible if we added the 1,5 liras to that and made Janan a lady with 2,0 liras?

english: But for Rakim, all happiness was destined to arrive mixed with a few tears; this happiness, too, had come in return for a fair amount of tears.

english: Was there anyone who wasn’t there, anyone?”

english: jan’s illness intensified after Monsieur Z--------, Rakim, and her father failed in the game they’d attempted to play out in front of her and after she’d revealed her secret. Because of this, Mr. Ziklas was worried about his other daughter, Margaret, and whisked her off to Alexandria with some ruses and promises. Upon the girl’s request, Mr. Ziklas invited Rakim by letter, asking to see her off at the ferry.
